com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AMQPConsumeConfig holds the configuration to immediately starts delivering queued messages

autoAck.description: AutoAck when true, the server will acknowledge deliveries to this consumer prior to writing the delivery to the network

consumerTag.description: ConsumerTag is the identity of the consumer included in every delivery

exclusive.description: Exclusive when true, the server will ensure that this is the sole consumer from this queue

noLocal.description: NoLocal flag is not supported by RabbitMQ

noWait.description: NowWait when true, do not wait for the server to confirm the request and immediately begin deliveries

auth.description: Auth hosts secret selectors for username and password

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

consume.description: Consume holds the configuration to immediately starts delivering queued messages For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.Consume

exchangeDeclare.description: ExchangeDeclare holds the configuration for the exchange on the server For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.ExchangeDeclare

exchangeName.description: ExchangeName is the exchange name For more information, visit https://www.rabbitmq.com/tutorials/amqp-concepts.html

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queueBind.description: QueueBind holds the configuration that binds an exchange to a queue so that publishings to the exchange will be routed to the queue when the publishing routing key matches the binding routing key For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.QueueBind

queueDeclare.description: QueueDeclare holds the configuration of a queue to hold messages and deliver to consumers. Declaring creates a queue if it doesn't already exist, or ensures that an existing queue matches the same parameters For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.QueueDeclare

tls.description: TLS configuration for the amqp client.

urlSecret.description: URLSecret is secret reference for rabbitmq service URL

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AMQPExchangeDeclareConfig holds the configuration for the exchange on the server

autoDelete.description: AutoDelete removes the exchange when no bindings are active

durable.description: Durable keeps the exchange also after the server restarts

internal.description: Internal when true does not accept publishings

noWait.description: NowWait when true does not wait for a confirmation from the server

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AMQPQueueBindConfig holds the configuration that binds an exchange to a queue so that publishings to the exchange will be routed to the queue when the publishing routing key matches the binding routing key

noWait.description: NowWait false and the queue could not be bound, the channel will be closed with an error

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AMQPQueueDeclareConfig holds the configuration of a queue to hold messages and deliver to consumers. Declaring creates a queue if it doesn't already exist, or ensures that an existing queue matches the same parameters

arguments.description: Arguments of a queue (also known as "x-arguments") used for optional features and plugins

autoDelete.description: AutoDelete removes the queue when no consumers are active

durable.description: Durable keeps the queue also after the server restarts

exclusive.description: Exclusive sets the queues to be accessible only by the connection that declares them and will be deleted wgen the connection closes

name.description: Name of the queue. If empty the server auto-generates a unique name for this queue

noWait.description: NowWait when true, the queue assumes to be declared on the server

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AWSLambdaTrigger refers to specification of the trigger to invoke an AWS Lambda function

accessKey.description: AccessKey refers K8s secret containing aws access key

functionName.description: FunctionName refers to the name of the function to invoke.

invocationType.description:
Choose from the following options.

   * RequestResponse (default) - Invoke the function synchronously. Keep
   the connection open until the function returns a response or times out.
   The API response includes the function response and additional data.

   * Event - Invoke the function asynchronously. Send events that fail multiple
   times to the function's dead-letter queue (if it's configured). The API
   response only includes a status code.

   * DryRun - Validate parameter values and verify that the user or role
   has permission to invoke the function.

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of key-value extracted from event's payload that are applied to the trigger resource.

payload.description: Payload is the list of key-value extracted from an event payload to construct the request payload.

secretKey.description: SecretKey refers K8s secret containing aws secret key

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AzureEventsHubEventSource describes the event source for azure events hub More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-hubs/

fqdn.description: FQDN of the EventHubs namespace you created More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-hubs/event-hubs-get-connection-string

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

sharedAccessKey.description: SharedAccessKey is the generated value of the key. If both this field and SharedAccessKeyName are not provided it will try to access via Azure AD with DefaultAzureCredential, FQDN and HubName.

sharedAccessKeyName.description: SharedAccessKeyName is the name you chose for your application's SAS keys. If both this field and SharedAccessKey are not provided it will try to access via Azure AD with DefaultAzureCredential, FQDN and HubName.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AzureQueueStorageEventSource describes the event source for azure queue storage more info at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/queues/

connectionString.description: ConnectionString is the connection string to access Azure Queue Storage. If this fields is not provided it will try to access via Azure AD with StorageAccountName.

decodeMessage.description: DecodeMessage specifies if all the messages should be base64 decoded. If set to true the decoding is done before the evaluation of JSONBody

dlq.description: DLQ specifies if a dead-letter queue is configured for messages that can't be processed successfully. If set to true, messages with invalid payload won't be acknowledged to allow to forward them farther to the dead-letter queue. The default value is false.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queueName.description: QueueName is the name of the queue

storageAccountName.description: StorageAccountName is the name of the storage account where the queue is. This field is necessary to access via Azure AD (managed identity) and it is ignored if ConnectionString is set.

waitTimeInSeconds.description: WaitTimeInSeconds is the duration (in seconds) for which the event source waits between empty results from the queue. The default value is 3 seconds.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: AzureServiceBusEventSource describes the event source for azure service bus More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-bus-messaging/

connectionString.description: ConnectionString is the connection string for the Azure Service Bus. If this fields is not provided it will try to access via Azure AD with DefaultAzureCredential and FullyQualifiedNamespace.

deferDelete.description: DeferDelete controls when messages are removed from Azure Service Bus. If false (default), messages are received and deleted immediately before processing. If true, messages are locked and only deleted after successful processing, ensuring they are not lost if processing fails.

fullyQualifiedNamespace.description: FullyQualifiedNamespace is the Service Bus namespace name (ex: myservicebus.servicebus.windows.net). This field is necessary to access via Azure AD (managed identity) and it is ignored if ConnectionString is set.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

subscriptionName.description: SubscriptionName is the name of the Azure Service Bus Topic Subscription

accessToken.description: AccessToken is reference to K8s secret which holds the bitbucket api access information.

bitbucketserverBaseURL.description: BitbucketServerBaseURL is the base URL for API requests to a custom endpoint.

checkInterval.description: CheckInterval is a duration in which to wait before checking that the webhooks exist, e.g. 1s, 30m, 2h... (defaults to 1m)

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

oneEventPerChange.description: OneEventPerChange controls whether to process each change in a repo:refs_changed webhook event as a separate event. This setting is useful when multiple tags are pushed simultaneously for the same commit, and each tag needs to independently trigger an action, such as a distinct workflow in Argo Workflows. When enabled, the BitbucketServerEventSource publishes an individual BitbucketServerEventData for each change, ensuring independent processing of each tag or reference update in a single webhook event.

projectKey.description: DeprecatedProjectKey is the key of project for which integration needs to set up. Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v1.8.

projects.description: Projects holds a list of projects for which integration needs to set up, this will add the webhook to all repositories in the project.

repositories.description: Repositories holds a list of repositories for which integration needs to set up.

repositorySlug.description: DeprecatedRepositorySlug is the slug of the repository for which integration needs to set up. Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v1.8.

skipBranchRefsChangedOnOpenPR.description: SkipBranchRefsChangedOnOpenPR bypasses the event repo:refs_changed for branches whenever there's an associated open pull request. This helps in optimizing the event handling process by avoiding unnecessary triggers for branch reference changes that are already part of a pull request under review.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the bitbucketserver client.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration to run a http server.

comparator.description: Comparator compares the event data with a user given value. Can be ">=", ">", "=", "!=", "<", or "<=". Is optional, and if left blank treated as equality "=".

path.description: Path is the JSONPath of the event's (JSON decoded) data key. Path is a series of keys separated by a dot. A key may contain wildcard characters '*' and '?'. To access an array value use the index as the key. The dot and wildcard characters can be escaped with '\\'. See https://github.com/tidwall/gjson#path-syntax for more information on how to use this.

template.description: Template is a go-template for extracting a string from the event's data. A Template is evaluated with provided path, type and value. The templating follows the standard go-template syntax as well as sprig's extra functions. See https://pkg.go.dev/text/template and https://masterminds.github.io/sprig/

type.description: Type contains the JSON type of the data

value.description: Value is the allowed string values for this key. Booleans are parsed using strconv.ParseBool(), Numbers are parsed as float64 using strconv.ParseFloat(), Strings are treated as regular expressions, Nils value is ignored.

to.description: To refers to the email addresses to which the emails are send.

username.description: Username refers to the username used to connect to the smtp server.

organizations.description: Organizations holds the names of organizations (used for organization level webhooks). Not required if Repositories is set.

owner.description: DeprecatedOwner refers to GitHub owner name i.e. argoproj Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v 1.6

repositories.description: Repositories holds the information of repositories, which uses repo owner as the key, and list of repo names as the value. Not required if Organizations is set.

repository.description: DeprecatedRepository refers to GitHub repo name i.e. argo-events Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v 1.6

webhook.description: Webhook refers to the configuration required to run a http server

webhookSecret.description: WebhookSecret refers to K8s secret containing GitHub webhook secret https://developer.github.com/webhooks/securing/

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: GitlabEventSource refers to event-source related to Gitlab events

accessToken.description: AccessToken references to k8 secret which holds the gitlab api access information

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the GitLab hook for the project once the event source is stopped.

events.description: Events are gitlab event to listen to. Refer https://github.com/xanzy/go-gitlab/blob/bf34eca5d13a9f4c3f501d8a97b8ac226d55e4d9/projects.go#L794.

gitlabBaseURL.description: GitlabBaseURL is the base URL for API requests to a custom endpoint

groups.description: List of group IDs or group name like "test". Group level hook available in Premium and Ultimate Gitlab.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projectID.description: DeprecatedProjectID is the id of project for which integration needs to setup Deprecated: use Projects instead. Will be unsupported in v 1.7

projects.description: List of project IDs or project namespace paths like "whynowy/test". If neither a project nor a group is defined, the EventSource will not manage webhooks.

secretToken.description: SecretToken references to k8 secret which holds the Secret Token used by webhook config

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration to run a http server

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: HDFSEventSource refers to event-source for HDFS related events

checkInterval.description: CheckInterval is a string that describes an interval duration to check the directory state, e.g. 1s, 30m, 2h... (defaults to 1m)

hdfsUser.description: HDFSUser is the user to access HDFS file system. It is ignored if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbCCacheSecret.description: KrbCCacheSecret is the secret selector for Kerberos ccache Either ccache or keytab can be set to use Kerberos.

krbConfigConfigMap.description: KrbConfig is the configmap selector for Kerberos config as string It must be set if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbKeytabSecret.description: KrbKeytabSecret is the secret selector for Kerberos keytab Either ccache or keytab can be set to use Kerberos.

krbRealm.description: KrbRealm is the Kerberos realm used with Kerberos keytab It must be set if keytab is used.

krbServicePrincipalName.description: KrbServicePrincipalName is the principal name of Kerberos service It must be set if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbUsername.description: KrbUsername is the Kerberos username used with Kerberos keytab It must be set if keytab is used.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

path.description: Path is relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

pathRegexp.description: PathRegexp is regexp of relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

type.description: Type of file operations to watch

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: HTTPTrigger is the trigger for the HTTP request

basicAuth.description: BasicAuth configuration for the http request.

dynamicHeaders.description: Dynamic Headers for the request, sourced from the event. Same spec as Parameters.

host.description: Host refers to the domain name of the server (for virtual hosting).

method.description: Method refers to the type of the HTTP request. Refer https://golang.org/src/net/http/method.go for more info. Default value is POST.

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of key-value extracted from event's payload that are applied to the HTTP trigger resource.

secureHeaders.description: Secure Headers stored in Kubernetes Secrets for the HTTP requests.

timeout.description: Timeout refers to the HTTP request timeout in seconds. Default value is 60 seconds.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the HTTP client.

url.description: URL refers to the URL to send HTTP request to.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: JetStreamBus holds the JetStream EventBus information

affinity.description: The pod's scheduling constraints More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/

containerTemplate.description: ContainerTemplate contains customized spec for Nats JetStream container

imagePullSecrets.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

maxPayload.description: Maximum number of bytes in a message payload, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1MB

metadata.description: Metadata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

metricsContainerTemplate.description: MetricsContainerTemplate contains customized spec for metrics container

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the Redis pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the value, the higher the priority. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the Redis pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and "system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

reloaderContainerTemplate.description: ReloaderContainerTemplate contains customized spec for config reloader container

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName to apply to the StatefulSet

settings.description: JetStream configuration, if not specified, global settings in controller-config will be used. See https://docs.nats.io/running-a-nats-service/configuration#jetstream. Only configure "max_memory_store" or "max_file_store", do not set "store_dir" as it has been hardcoded.

startArgs.description: Optional arguments to start nats-server. For example, "-D" to enable debugging output, "-DV" to enable debugging and tracing. Check https://docs.nats.io/ for all the available arguments.

streamConfig.description: Optional configuration for the streams to be created in this JetStream service, if specified, it will be merged with the default configuration in controller-config. It accepts a YAML format configuration, available fields include, "maxBytes", "maxMsgs", "maxAge" (e.g. 72h), "replicas" (1, 3, 5), "duplicates" (e.g. 5m), "retention" (e.g.0: Limits (default), 1: Interest, 2: WorkQueue), "Discard" (e.g.0: DiscardOld (default), 1: DiscardNew).

tls.description: SSL/TLS settings for the NATS client

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: K8SResource represent arbitrary structured data.
K8SResourcePolicy refers to the policy used to check the state of K8s based triggers using labels

errorOnBackoffTimeout.description: ErrorOnBackoffTimeout determines whether sensor should transition to error state if the trigger policy is unable to determine the state of the resource

labels.description: Labels required to identify whether a resource is in success state

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: KafkaBus holds the KafkaBus EventBus information

partitioner.description: Partitioner sets the Kafka producer partitioning strategy. Supported values: random, hash, roundrobin, manual. Defaults to random.

sasl.description: SASL configuration for the kafka client

tls.description: TLS configuration for the kafka client.

url.description: URL to kafka cluster, multiple URLs separated by comma

version.description: Kafka version, sarama defaults to the oldest supported stable version

groupName.description: The name for the consumer group to use

oldest.description: When starting up a new group do we want to start from the oldest event (true) or the newest event (false), defaults to false

rebalanceStrategy.description: Rebalance strategy can be one of: sticky, roundrobin, range. Range is the default.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: KafkaEventSource refers to event-source for Kafka related events

config.description:
Yaml format Sarama config for Kafka connection. It follows the struct of sarama.Config. See https://github.com/IBM/sarama/blob/main/config.go e.g.

consumer:
  fetch:
    min: 1
net:
  MaxOpenRequests: 5

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

limitEventsPerSecond.description: Sets a limit on how many events get read from kafka per second.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

sasl.description: SASL configuration for the kafka client

schemaRegistry.description: Schema Registry configuration for consumer message with Avro format

tls.description: TLS configuration for the kafka client.

url.description: URL to kafka cluster, multiple URLs separated by comma

version.description: Specify what kafka version is being connected to enables certain features in sarama, defaults to 1.0.0

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: KafkaTrigger refers to the specification of the Kafka trigger.

compress.description: Compress determines whether to compress message or not. Defaults to false. If set to true, compresses message using snappy compression.

flushFrequency.description: FlushFrequency refers to the frequency in milliseconds to flush batches. Defaults to 500 milliseconds.

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of parameters that is applied to resolved Kafka trigger object.

partitioningKey.description: The partitioning key for the messages put on the Kafka topic.

payload.description: Payload is the list of key-value extracted from an event payload to construct the request payload.

requiredAcks.description: RequiredAcks used in producer to tell the broker how many replica acknowledgements Defaults to 1 (Only wait for the leader to ack).

sasl.description: SASL configuration for the kafka client

schemaRegistry.description: Schema Registry configuration to producer message with avro format

secureHeaders.description: Secure Headers stored in Kubernetes Secrets for the Kafka messages.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the Kafka producer.

topic.description: Name of the topic. More info at https://kafka.apache.org/documentation/#intro_topics

url.description: URL of the Kafka broker, multiple URLs separated by comma.

version.description: Specify what kafka version is being connected to enables certain features in sarama, defaults to 1.0.0

intervalSeconds.description: Only print messages every interval. Useful to prevent logging too much data for busy events.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: MNSEventSource refers to event-source for AlibabaCloud MNS related events

accessKey.description: AccessKey refers K8s secret containing AlibabaCloud access key

endpoint.description: Endpoint configures connection to a specific AlibabaCloud MNS endpoint

queue.description: Queue is AlibabaCloud MNS queue to listen to for messages

secretKey.description: SecretKey refers K8s secret containing AlibabaCloud secret key

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: MQTTEventSource refers to event-source for MQTT related events

auth.description: Auth hosts secret selectors for username and password

clientId.description: ClientID is the id of the client

connectionBackoff.description: ConnectionBackoff holds backoff applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the mqtt client.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: Metadata holds the annotations and labels of an event source pod
NATSAuth refers to the auth info for NATS EventSource

basic.description: Baisc auth with username and password

exotic.description: Exotic holds an exotic NATS config

native.description: Native means to bring up a native NATS service

NATSEventsSource refers to event-source for NATS related events

connectionBackoff.description: ConnectionBackoff holds backoff applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queue.description: Queue is the name of the queue group to subscribe as if specified. Uses QueueSubscribe logic to subscribe as queue group. If the queue is empty, uses default Subscribe logic.

subject.description: Subject holds the name of the subject onto which messages are published

tls.description: TLS configuration for the nats client.

url.description: URL to connect to NATS cluster

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: NATSTrigger refers to the specification of the NATS trigger.

subject.description: Name of the subject to put message on.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the NATS producer.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: NSQEventSource describes the event source for NSQ PubSub More info at https://godoc.org/github.com/nsqio/go-nsq

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress is the address of the host for NSQ lookup

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the nsq client.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: NativeStrategy indicates to install a native NATS service

affinity.description: The pod's scheduling constraints More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/

containerTemplate.description: ContainerTemplate contains customized spec for NATS container

imagePullSecrets.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

maxAge.description: Max Age of existing messages, i.e. "72h", 4h35m

maxBytes.description: Total size of messages per channel, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1GB

maxMsgs.description: Maximum number of messages per channel, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1000000

maxPayload.description: Maximum number of bytes in a message payload, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1MB

maxSubs.description: Maximum number of subscriptions per channel, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1000

metadata.description: Metadata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

metricsContainerTemplate.description: MetricsContainerTemplate contains customized spec for metrics container

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the EventSource pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the value, the higher the priority. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the EventSource pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and "system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

raftCommitTimeout.description: Specifies the time without an Apply() operation before sending an heartbeat to ensure timely commit, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 100ms

raftElectionTimeout.description: Specifies the time in candidate state without a leader before attempting an election, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 2s

raftHeartbeatTimeout.description: Specifies the time in follower state without a leader before attempting an election, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 2s

raftLeaseTimeout.description: Specifies how long a leader waits without being able to contact a quorum of nodes before stepping down as leader, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 1s

replicas.description: Size is the NATS StatefulSet size

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName to apply to NATS StatefulSet

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: OpenWhiskTrigger refers to the specification of the OpenWhisk trigger.

namespace.description: Namespace for the action. Defaults to "_".

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of key-value extracted from event's payload that are applied to the trigger resource.

payload.description: Payload is the list of key-value extracted from an event payload to construct the request payload.

version.description: Version for the API. Defaults to v1.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: PayloadField binds a value at path within the event payload against a name.

name.description: Name acts as key that holds the value at the path.

path.description: Path is the JSONPath of the event's (JSON decoded) data key Path is a series of keys separated by a dot. A key may contain wildcard characters '*' and '?'. To access an array value use the index as the key. The dot and wildcard characters can be escaped with '\\'. See https://github.com/tidwall/gjson#path-syntax for more information on how to use this.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: PersistenceStrategy defines the strategy of persistence

accessMode.description: Available access modes such as ReadWriteOnce, ReadWriteMany https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#access-modes

storageClassName.description: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#class-1

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: PubSubEventSource refers to event-source for GCP PubSub related events.

credentialSecret.description: CredentialSecret references to the secret that contains JSON credentials to access GCP. If it is missing, it implicitly uses Workload Identity to access. https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/workload-identity

deleteSubscriptionOnFinish.description: DeleteSubscriptionOnFinish determines whether to delete the GCP PubSub subscription once the event source is stopped.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projectID.description: ProjectID is GCP project ID for the subscription. Required if you run Argo Events outside of GKE/GCE. (otherwise, the default value is its project)

subscriptionID.description: SubscriptionID is ID of subscription. Required if you use existing subscription. The default value will be auto generated hash based on this eventsource setting, so the subscription might be recreated every time you update the setting, which has a possibility of event loss.

topic.description: Topic to which the subscription should belongs. Required if you want the eventsource to create a new subscription. If you specify this field along with an existing subscription, it will be verified whether it actually belongs to the specified topic.

topicProjectID.description: TopicProjectID is GCP project ID for the topic. By default, it is same as ProjectID.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: PulsarEventSource describes the event source for Apache Pulsar

authAthenzParams.description: Authentication athenz parameters for the pulsar client. Refer https://github.com/apache/pulsar-client-go/blob/master/pulsar/auth/athenz.go Either token or athenz can be set to use auth.

authAthenzSecret.description: Authentication athenz privateKey secret for the pulsar client. AuthAthenzSecret must be set if AuthAthenzParams is used.

authTokenSecret.description: Authentication token for the pulsar client. Either token or athenz can be set to use auth.

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the pulsar client.

tlsAllowInsecureConnection.description: Whether the Pulsar client accept untrusted TLS certificate from broker.

tlsValidateHostname.description: Whether the Pulsar client verify the validity of the host name from broker.

topics.description: Name of the topics to subscribe to.

type.description: Type of the subscription. Only "exclusive" and "shared" is supported. Defaults to exclusive.

url.description: Configure the service URL for the Pulsar service.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: PulsarTrigger refers to the specification of the Pulsar trigger.

authAthenzParams.description: Authentication athenz parameters for the pulsar client. Refer https://github.com/apache/pulsar-client-go/blob/master/pulsar/auth/athenz.go Either token or athenz can be set to use auth.

authAthenzSecret.description: Authentication athenz privateKey secret for the pulsar client. AuthAthenzSecret must be set if AuthAthenzParams is used.

authTokenSecret.description: Authentication token for the pulsar client. Either token or athenz can be set to use auth.

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of parameters that is applied to resolved Kafka trigger object.

payload.description: Payload is the list of key-value extracted from an event payload to construct the request payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the pulsar client.

tlsValidateHostname.description: Whether the Pulsar client verify the validity of the host name from broker.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: RedisEventSource describes an event source for the Redis PubSub. More info at https://godoc.org/github.com/go-redis/redis#example-PubSub

db.description: DB to use. If not specified, default DB 0 will be used.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress refers to the address of the Redis host/server

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

namespace.description: Namespace to use to retrieve the password from. It should only be specified if password is declared

password.description: Password required for authentication if any.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the redis client.

username.description: Username required for ACL style authentication if any.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: RedisStreamEventSource describes an event source for Redis streams (https://redis.io/topics/streams-intro)

consumerGroup.description: ConsumerGroup refers to the Redis stream consumer group that will be created on all redis streams. Messages are read through this group. Defaults to 'argo-events-cg'

db.description: DB to use. If not specified, default DB 0 will be used.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress refers to the address of the Redis host/server (master instance)

maxMsgCountPerRead.description: MaxMsgCountPerRead holds the maximum number of messages per stream that will be read in each XREADGROUP of all streams Example: if there are 2 streams and MaxMsgCountPerRead=10, then each XREADGROUP may read upto a total of 20 messages. Same as COUNT option in XREADGROUP(https://redis.io/topics/streams-intro). Defaults to 10

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

password.description: Password required for authentication if any.

streams.description: Streams to look for entries. XREADGROUP is used on all streams using a single consumer group.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the redis client.

username.description: Username required for ACL style authentication if any.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: ResourceEventSource refers to a event-source for K8s resource related events.

eventTypes.description: EventTypes is the list of event type to watch. Possible values are - ADD, UPDATE and DELETE.

filter.description: Filter is applied on the metadata of the resource If you apply filter, then the internal event informer will only monitor objects that pass the filter.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: ResourceFilter contains K8s ObjectMeta information to further filter resource event objects

afterStart.description: If the resource is created after the start time then the event is treated as valid.

createdBy.description: If resource is created before the specified time then the event is treated as valid.

fields.description: Fields provide field filters similar to K8s field selector (see https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/field-selectors/). Unlike K8s field selector, it supports arbitrary fileds like "spec.serviceAccountName", and the value could be a string or a regex. Same as K8s field selector, operator "=", "==" and "!=" are supported.

labels.description: Labels provide listing options to K8s API to watch resource/s. Refer https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/label-selectors/ for more info. Unlike K8s field selector, multiple values are passed as comma separated values instead of list of values. Eg: value: value1,value2. Same as K8s label selector, operator "=", "==", "!=", "exists", "!", "notin", "in", "gt" and "lt" are supported

prefix.description: Prefix filter is applied on the resource name.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: S3Artifact contains information about an S3 connection and bucket

username.description: Username required for authentication if any.

watchPathConfig.description: WatchPathConfig contains configuration about the file path to watch

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: SchemaRegistryConfig refers to configuration for a client
SecureHeader refers to HTTP Headers with auth tokens as values

valueFrom.description: Values can be read from either secrets or configmaps

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: Selector represents conditional operation to select K8s objects.

operation.description: Supported operations like ==, != etc. Defaults to ==. Refer https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors for more info.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: Sensor is the definition of a sensor resource

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: SensorList is the list of Sensor resources

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: SensorSpec represents desired sensor state

dependencies.description: Dependencies is a list of the events that this sensor is dependent on.

errorOnFailedRound.description: ErrorOnFailedRound if set to true, marks sensor state as `error` if the previous trigger round fails. Once sensor state is set to `error`, no further triggers will be processed.

eventBusName.description: EventBusName references to a EventBus name. By default the value is "default"

loggingFields.description: LoggingFields add additional key-value pairs when logging happens

replicas.description: Replicas is the sensor deployment replicas

revisionHistoryLimit.description: RevisionHistoryLimit specifies how many old deployment revisions to retain

template.description: Template is the pod specification for the sensor

triggers.description: Triggers is a list of the things that this sensor evokes. These are the outputs from this sensor.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: SensorStatus contains information about the status of a sensor.

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: Service holds the service information eventsource exposes

clusterIP.description: clusterIP is the IP address of the service and is usually assigned randomly by the master. If an address is specified manually and is not in use by others, it will be allocated to the service; otherwise, creation of the service will fail. This field can not be changed through updates. Valid values are "None", empty string (""), or a valid IP address. "None" can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

metadata.description: Metadata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels default={annotations: {}, labels: {}}

ports.description: The list of ports that are exposed by this ClusterIP service.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: SlackEventSource refers to event-source for Slack related events

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

icon.description: Icon is the Slack application's icon, e.g. :robot_face: or https://example.com/image.png

username.description: Username is the Slack application's username

broadcastMessageToChannel.description: BroadcastMessageToChannel allows to also broadcast the message from the thread to the channel

messageAggregationKey.description: MessageAggregationKey allows to aggregate the messages to a thread by some key.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: SlackTrigger refers to the specification of the slack notification trigger.

attachments.description: Attachments is a JSON format string that represents an array of Slack attachments according to the attachments API: https://api.slack.com/reference/messaging/attachments .

blocks.description: Blocks is a JSON format string that represents an array of Slack blocks according to the blocks API: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks .

channel.description: Channel refers to which Slack channel to send Slack message.

message.description: Message refers to the message to send to the Slack channel.

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of key-value extracted from event's payload that are applied to the trigger resource.

sender.description: Sender refers to additional configuration of the Slack application that sends the message.

slackToken.description: SlackToken refers to the Kubernetes secret that holds the slack token required to send messages.

thread.description: Thread refers to additional options for sending messages to a Slack thread.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: StandardK8STrigger is the standard Kubernetes resource trigger

liveObject.description: LiveObject specifies whether the resource should be directly fetched from K8s instead of being marshaled from the resource artifact. If set to true, the resource artifact must contain the information required to uniquely identify the resource in the cluster, that is, you must specify "apiVersion", "kind" as well as "name" and "namespace" meta data. Only valid for operation type `update`

operation.description: Operation refers to the type of operation performed on the k8s resource. Default value is Create.

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of parameters that is applied to resolved K8s trigger object.

patchStrategy.description: PatchStrategy controls the K8s object patching strategy when the trigger operation is specified as patch. possible values: "application/json-patch+json" "application/merge-patch+json" "application/strategic-merge-patch+json" "application/apply-patch+yaml". Defaults to "application/merge-patch+json"

source.description: Source of the K8s resource file(s)

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: Status is a common structure which can be used for Status field.

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: StatusPolicy refers to the policy used to check the state of the trigger using response status
StorageGridEventSource refers to event-source for StorageGrid related events

apiURL.description: APIURL is the url of the storagegrid api.

bucket.description: Name of the bucket to register notifications for.

filter.description: Filter on object key which caused the notification.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the service bus client

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: StorageGridFilter represents filters to apply to bucket notifications for specifying constraints on objects
StripeEventSource describes the event source for stripe webhook notifications More info at https://stripe.com/docs/webhooks

apiKey.description: APIKey refers to K8s secret that holds Stripe API key. Used only if CreateWebhook is enabled.

createWebhook.description: CreateWebhook if specified creates a new webhook programmatically.

eventFilter.description: EventFilter describes the type of events to listen to. If not specified, all types of events will be processed. More info at https://stripe.com/docs/api/events/list

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: TLSConfig refers to TLS configuration for a client.

caCertSecret.description: CACertSecret refers to the secret that contains the CA cert

clientCertSecret.description: ClientCertSecret refers to the secret that contains the client cert

clientKeySecret.description: ClientKeySecret refers to the secret that contains the client key

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if TLS is enabled. Added for compatibility proposes for Brokers that needs TLS without key authentication

insecureSkipVerify.description: If true, skips creation of TLSConfig with certs and creates an empty TLSConfig. (Defaults to false)

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: Template holds the information of a deployment template

affinity.description: If specified, the pod's scheduling constraints

container.description: Container is the main container image to run in the sensor pod

imagePullSecrets.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

metadata.description: Metadata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the EventSource pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the value, the higher the priority. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the EventSource pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and "system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run sensor pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/

volumes.description: Volumes is a list of volumes that can be mounted by containers in a workflow.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: TimeFilter describes a window in time. It filters out events that occur outside the time limits. In other words, only events that occur after Start and before Stop will pass this filter.

start.description: Start is the beginning of a time window in UTC. Before this time, events for this dependency are ignored. Format is hh:mm:ss.

stop.description: Stop is the end of a time window in UTC. After or equal to this time, events for this dependency are ignored and Format is hh:mm:ss. If it is smaller than Start, it is treated as next day of Start (e.g.: 22:00:00-01:00:00 means 22:00:00-25:00:00).

timezone.description: Timezone specifies the timezone for the time window. If not specified, defaults to UTC. Format should be a valid IANA timezone name (e.g., "America/New_York", "Europe/London").

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: Trigger is an action taken, output produced, an event created, a message sent

atLeastOnce.description: AtLeastOnce determines the trigger execution semantics. Defaults to false. Trigger execution will use at-most-once semantics. If set to true, Trigger execution will switch to at-least-once semantics.

dlqTrigger.description: If the trigger fails, it will retry up to the configured number of retries. If the maximum retries are reached and the trigger is set to execute atLeastOnce, the dead letter queue (DLQ) trigger will be invoked if specified.  Invoking the dead letter queue trigger helps prevent data loss.

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of parameters applied to the trigger template definition

policy.description: Policy to configure backoff and execution criteria for the trigger

rateLimit.description: Rate limit, default unit is Second

retryStrategy.description: Retry strategy, defaults to no retry

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: TriggerParameter indicates a passed parameter to a service template

dest.description: Dest is the JSONPath of a resource key. A path is a series of keys separated by a dot. The colon character can be escaped with '.' The -1 key can be used to append a value to an existing array. See https://github.com/tidwall/sjson#path-syntax for more information about how this is used.

operation.description: Operation is what to do with the existing value at Dest, whether to 'prepend', 'overwrite', or 'append' it.

src.description: Src contains a source reference to the value of the parameter from a dependency

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: TriggerParameterSource defines the source for a parameter from a event event

contextKey.description: ContextKey is the JSONPath of the event's (JSON decoded) context key ContextKey is a series of keys separated by a dot. A key may contain wildcard characters '*' and '?'. To access an array value use the index as the key. The dot and wildcard characters can be escaped with '\\'. See https://github.com/tidwall/gjson#path-syntax for more information on how to use this.

contextTemplate.description: ContextTemplate is a go-template for extracting a string from the event's context. If a ContextTemplate is provided with a ContextKey, the template will be evaluated first and fallback to the ContextKey. The templating follows the standard go-template syntax as well as sprig's extra functions. See https://pkg.go.dev/text/template and https://masterminds.github.io/sprig/

dataKey.description: DataKey is the JSONPath of the event's (JSON decoded) data key DataKey is a series of keys separated by a dot. A key may contain wildcard characters '*' and '?'. To access an array value use the index as the key. The dot and wildcard characters can be escaped with '\\'. See https://github.com/tidwall/gjson#path-syntax for more information on how to use this.

dataTemplate.description: DataTemplate is a go-template for extracting a string from the event's data. If a DataTemplate is provided with a DataKey, the template will be evaluated first and fallback to the DataKey. The templating follows the standard go-template syntax as well as sprig's extra functions. See https://pkg.go.dev/text/template and https://masterminds.github.io/sprig/

dependencyName.description: DependencyName refers to the name of the dependency. The event which is stored for this dependency is used as payload for the parameterization. Make sure to refer to one of the dependencies you have defined under Dependencies list.

useRawData.description: UseRawData indicates if the value in an event at data key should be used without converting to string. When true, a number, boolean, json or string parameter may be extracted. When the field is unspecified, or explicitly false, the behavior is to turn the extracted field into a string. (e.g. when set to true, the parameter 123 will resolve to the numerical type, but when false, or not provided, the string "123" will be resolved)

value.description: Value is the default literal value to use for this parameter source This is only used if the DataKey is invalid. If the DataKey is invalid and this is not defined, this param source will produce an error.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: TriggerPolicy dictates the policy for the trigger retries

k8s.description: K8SResourcePolicy refers to the policy used to check the state of K8s based triggers using using labels

status.description: Status refers to the policy used to check the state of the trigger using response status

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: TriggerTemplate is the template that describes trigger specification.

argoWorkflow.description: ArgoWorkflow refers to the trigger that can perform various operations on an Argo workflow.

awsLambda.description: AWSLambda refers to the trigger designed to invoke AWS Lambda function with with on-the-fly constructable payload.

azureEventHubs.description: AzureEventHubs refers to the trigger send an event to an Azure Event Hub.

azureServiceBus.description: AzureServiceBus refers to the trigger designed to place messages on Azure Service Bus

conditions.description: Conditions is the conditions to execute the trigger. For example: "(dep01 || dep02) && dep04"

custom.description: CustomTrigger refers to the trigger designed to connect to a gRPC trigger server and execute a custom trigger.

email.description: Email refers to the trigger designed to send an email notification

http.description: HTTP refers to the trigger designed to dispatch a HTTP request with on-the-fly constructable payload.

k8s.description: StandardK8STrigger refers to the trigger designed to create or update a generic Kubernetes resource.

kafka.description: Kafka refers to the trigger designed to place messages on Kafka topic.

log.description: Log refers to the trigger designed to invoke log the event.

name.description: Name is a unique name of the action to take.

nats.description: NATS refers to the trigger designed to place message on NATS subject.

openWhisk.description: OpenWhisk refers to the trigger designed to invoke OpenWhisk action.

pulsar.description: Pulsar refers to the trigger designed to place messages on Pulsar topic.

slack.description: Slack refers to the trigger designed to send slack notification message.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: URLArtifact contains information about an artifact at an HTTP endpoint.

verifyCert.description: VerifyCert decides whether the connection is secure or not

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: ValueFromSource allows you to reference keys from either a Configmap or Secret

path.description: Path is relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

pathRegexp.description: PathRegexp is regexp of relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: WebhookContext holds a general purpose REST API context

authSecret.description: AuthSecret holds a secret selector that contains a bearer token for authentication

maxPayloadSize.description: MaxPayloadSize is the maximum webhook payload size that the server will accept. Requests exceeding that limit will be rejected with "request too large" response. Default value: 1048576 (1MB).

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

method.description: Method is HTTP request method that indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. See RFC7231 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content

port.description: Port on which HTTP server is listening for incoming events.

serverCertSecret.description: ServerCertPath refers the file that contains the cert.

serverKeySecret.description: ServerKeyPath refers the file that contains private key

url.description: URL is the url of the server.

com.github.argoproj.argo-events.pkg.apis.description: CalendarEventSource describes an HTTP based EventSource

authSecret.description: AuthSecret holds a secret selector that contains a bearer token for authentication

maxPayloadSize.description: MaxPayloadSize is the maximum webhook payload size that the server will accept. Requests exceeding that limit will be rejected with "request too large" response. Default value: 1048576 (1MB).

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

method.description: Method is HTTP request method that indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. See RFC7231 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content

port.description: Port on which HTTP server is listening for incoming events.

serverCertSecret.description: ServerCertPath refers the file that contains the cert.

serverKeySecret.description: ServerKeyPath refers the file that contains private key

url.description: URL is the url of the server.
